content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Wild jade vine
 This fight takes place in an instanced area.
On death you can pay Arno to retrieve any lost items. You will be charged 25,000 for this service. Should you die an unsafe death a second time before retrieving all your items, they will be lost completely.
This article is about the Hespori that can be grown and fought in the farming guild. For the boss in A Night at the Theatre, see Hespori (A Night at the Theatre).

Monster ID8583

The Hespori is a sporadic boss. In order to fight it, players must first plant a Hespori seed in the Hespori patch within the west wing of the Farming Guild, which requires level 65 Farming to access (boostable) and 60% Hosidius favour. It takes 22-32 hours to grow, depending on when it was planted. When fully grown, the flower behind the cave entrance will sprout open.

According to Arno, the Hespori is a rare carnivorous plant originating from Morytania, becoming conscious and highly aggressive once fully grown. They were also used as a weapon against vampyres by Queen Efaritay[1]. The Hespori's appearance is also extremely similar to that of The Maiden of Sugadinti, and it has been confirmed that there is a possible link between the two.[2]

Killing the Hespori allows it to be harvested, which grants 12,600 (12,915 with full Farmer's outfit) Farming experience, as well as seeds, including the rare white lily and anima seeds, along with the bottomless compost bucket.

Casting Resurrect Crops on Hespori after the fight yields no Farming experience or loot. Casting the spell results in the message "Your Spell fails and the patch is cleared."

Fight overview[edit | edit source]

A player battles the Hespori.
A defeated Hespori.

There are four flower buds surrounding the patch. The flowers will open up three times during the fight: once upon starting, again after the Hespori reaches below 66% of its health, and a final time after it reaches below 33% of its health. They have 10 hitpoints each and always die in one hit. The Hespori cannot be attacked while any of them are open, so you must subdue all of them before the Hespori can be harmed.

The Hespori can attack with both magic and ranged. The magic attack's animation looks like the Hespori is twirling around, and can hit up to 14, while the ranged attack has the Hespori swinging its arms and throwing green spores at the player, and can hit twice for up to 8 each time. Protection prayers will not completely negate the damage, but will greatly reduce it.

The Hespori will sometimes bind you with roots similar to the entangle spell, rendering you unable to move or attack. When you are rooted, click repeatedly on the floor, preferably the square next to you, or on the Hespori itself to try and struggle free until you can move and attack again. The chatbox will notify you when you become entangled and when you free yourself. If you don't free yourself in time, the vines will break on their own and hit you for a maximum of over 40 damage. The Hespori can also poison you, so bringing an antipoison or better (or simply drinking a dose before the fight) is recommended.

Once the Hespori is defeated, players must clear the patch with a spade in order to obtain their loot. Players may leave the lair after this point and come back without having to do the fight again.

Setup[edit | edit source]

The best melee setup consists of armour, generally Barrows equipment or Bandos armour with high ranged defence and high strength bonus, with a good slash weapon, such as a dragon scimitar or abyssal whip, at high melee stats (60+ recommended). Protect from Magic should be activated as this is your lowest defence, not ranged. Alternatively, a setup high in both ranged and magic defence can be sufficient, but you will be eating a lot more food this way, as the Hespori will attack you with both combat styles. Eight pieces of food—monkfish or better - will suffice, along with an antipoison, spade, and a prayer potion. Note that a ring of recoil does not appear to have any effect against the Hespori. To speed up the kills, you can bring a (super) combat potion/super set and/or use melee-boosting prayers like Piety. It's recommended to bring a ranged weapon, like cheap darts, to easily kill the flowers, as they always die in one hit.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 60,326 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Hespori kill is worth 37,086.59. The player will have one roll on each of the two drop tables: anima seeds and normal seeds. The normal seed table also contains the bottomless compost bucket, which can hold up to 10,000 compost of any kind. In addition, Hespori has a chance to give the Tangleroot pet as a tertiary drop.

  1. ↑ Range is the chance from 65 to 99. The chance increases with the player's Farming level, and is calculated with the formula: 1 B − ( L v l ∗ 25 ) {\displaystyle {\frac {1}{B-(Lvl*25)}}} , where B is the base chance (7000 for Hespori) and Lvl is the player's Farming level. For more information, see Tangleroot.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve Hespori.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Hespori Adept Kill Hespori 5 times. Hard Kill count
Hesporisn't Finish off Hespori with a special attack. Hard Mechanical
Weed Whacker Kill all of Hesporis flowers within 5 seconds. Hard Mechanical
Plant-Based Diet Kill Hespori without losing any prayer points. Elite Restriction
Hespori Speed-Trialist Kill the Hespori in less than 48 seconds. Elite Speed
Hespori Speed-Chaser Kill the Hespori in less than 36 seconds. Master Speed

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
9 December 2021
(update)

The minimum HiScores killcount required for Hespori has been lowered from 10 to 5.

7 July 2021
(update)

The Hespori's immunity will now end immediately after killing the last flower.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Mysterious Stranger, Old School RuneScape. "They were grown here back when this place was still known as Hallowvale. The Saradominist Queen of the region used them as weapons against the vampyres."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 13 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 28 April 2020.) Mod Ash: "[The Hespori bears a striking resemblance to the Maiden from TOB. It's also a plant from Morytania. Is there a possible link between the two?] Yes :)"
  3. ↑ 3.0 3.1 Jagex. Mod Munro's Twitter account. 13 February 2019. (Archived from the original on 25 March 2019.) Mod Munro: "As I mentioned on the Q & A, here are the pictures of the drop rates for various parts of Kebos. This time with the correct drop rate for the pieces of the Brimstone Ring."
